mdRecord.dcterms:title: Survey notes, 1759 October 1-2
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: George Washington drafted this survey of his Mount Vernon property in early October 1759. 'I endeavourd to find out the true bounds of my Mount Vernon Tract of Land - but not knowing where it divided from Spencer's part on the River, nor being able to find Harrison Cornr. Ash mentioned in his Deed to stand on the River side at the Mouth of the Blind Pocoson - I began at two Ash trees and an Elm looking abt 10 poles above ye Mouth of the Run that comes out of the blind Pocoson and Reversd the dividing course of my Land.' Autograph document, 2 pages, laminated.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
